p: The ability of the SoEO to inhibit bacteria and fungi (indicator organisms) was summarized (see Table 3 (Tab. 3) and 4 (Tab. 4)). Both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria were inhibited by the SoEO. According to MIC and MBC values reported in Table 3 (Tab. 3), the SoEO showed an interesting activity against the Gram-positive pathogens ( S. aureus and M. luteus) and also a very good activity against B. cereus and B. subtilis with MIC values of 0.625 and 0.312 mg/mL, respectively. However, the SoEO cultivated in south Brazil, showed no activity against several Staphylococcus strains (Delamare Longaray et al., 2007[ 10]).
